segments.text: The artist is the creator of beautiful things. To reveal art and conceal the artist is art’s aim.

voice_traits.pauses: pausing briefly after 'beautiful things' and 'the artist'

segments.text: The critic is he who can translate into another manner or a new material his impression of beautiful things.
The highest as the lowest form of criticism is a mode of autobiography. Those who find ugly meanings in beautiful things are corrupt without being charming. This is a fault.

voice_traits.pauses: pausing to let the weight of 'ugly' and 'beautiful' resonate

segments.text: Those who find beautiful meanings in beautiful things are the cultivated. For these there is hope. They are the elect to whom beautiful things mean only beauty.

voice_traits.pronunciation: crisp, with clear emphasis on adjectives
voice_traits.pauses: gentle pauses following each major clause
voice_traits.distinctive_speech_patterns: slightly musical, with an air of intellectual elegance

segments.text: There is no such thing as a moral or an immoral book. Books are well written, or badly written. That is all.

voice_traits.pronunciation: precise with emphasis on 'well written' and 'badly written'

segments.text: The nineteenth century dislike of realism is the rage of Caliban seeing his own face in a glass.

segments.text: The nineteenth century dislike of romanticism is the rage of Caliban not seeing his own face in a glass.

segments.text: The moral life of man forms part of the subject-matter of the artist, but the morality of art consists in the perfect use of an imperfect medium. No artist desires to prove anything. Even things that are true can be proved. No artist has ethical sympathies. An ethical sympathy in an artist is an unpardonable mannerism of style. No artist is ever morbid. The artist can express everything. Thought and language are to the artist instruments of an art. Vice and virtue are to the artist materials for an art.

voice_traits.emotion: intensely committed to the ideals of art
voice_traits.pronunciation: precise, with particular clarity when stating contrasts
voice_traits.pauses: strategically placed to underline the shift from concept to concept

segments.text: From the point of view of feeling, the actor’s craft is the type.

segments.text: All art is at once surface and symbol. Those who go beneath the surface do so at their peril. Those who read the symbol do so at their peril. It is the spectator, and not life, that art really mirrors. Diversity of opinion about a work of art shows that the work is new, complex, and vital. When critics disagree, the artist is in accord with himself.
